description: Use chat history to rephrase user question, then answer the rephrased question using retrieved docs from vector store

data.label: Prompt Template
data.name: promptTemplate
data.description: Schema to represent a basic prompt for an LLM

inputParams.label: Template
inputParams.name: template
inputParams.placeholder: What is a good name for a company that makes {product}?

data.label: Chat Prompt Template
data.name: chatPromptTemplate
data.description: Schema to represent a chat prompt

inputParams.label: System Message
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.placeholder: You are a helpful assistant that translates {input_language} to {output_language}.

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
Using the provided context, answer the user's question to the best of your ability using the resources provided. If there is nothing in the context relevant to the question at hand, just say "Hmm, I'm not sure." Don't try to make up an answer.

Anything between the following \`context\`  html blocks is retrieved from a knowledge bank, not part of the conversation with the user.

<context>
    {context}
<context/>

REMEMBER: If there is no relevant information within the context, just say "Hmm, I'm not sure." Don't try to make up an answer. Anything between the preceding 'context' html blocks is retrieved from a knowledge bank, not part of the conversation with the user.

data.label: VectorStore To Document
data.name: vectorStoreToDocument
data.description: Search documents with scores from vector store

inputParams.label: Query
inputParams.name: query
inputParams.description: Query to retrieve documents from vector database. If not specified, user question will be used

inputParams.label: Minimum Score (%)
inputParams.name: minScore
inputParams.description: Minumum score for embeddings documents to be included

data.name: llmChain
data.description: Chain to run queries against LLMs

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

data.label: ChatOpenAI
data.name: chatOpenAI
data.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Automatically uses gpt-4-vision-preview when image is being uploaded from chat. Only works with LLMChain, Conversation Chain, ReAct Agent, and Conversational Agent

inputParams.label: Image Resolution
inputParams.description: This parameter controls the resolution in which the model views the image.
inputParams.name: imageResolution

data.label: SingleStore
data.name: singlestore
data.description: Upsert embedded data and perform similarity search upon query using SingleStore, a fast and distributed cloud relational database

inputParams.label: Connect Credential
inputParams.name: credential
inputParams.description: Needed when using SingleStore cloud hosted

data.label: OpenAI Embeddings
data.name: openAIEmbeddings
data.description: OpenAI API to generate embeddings for a given text

outputAnchors.name: openAIEmbeddings
outputAnchors.label: OpenAIEmbeddings
outputAnchors.description: OpenAI API to generate embeddings for a given text

inputs.note:
First, we rephrase the question using context from previous conversation.

This is to ensure that a follow-up question can be asked. For example:

- What is the address of the Bakery shop?
- What about the opening time?

A rephrased question will be:
- What is the opening time of the Bakery shop?

This ensure a better search to vector store, hence better results
Second, rephrased question is used to do a similarity search to find relevant context
Last, using the context from vector store, we instruct LLM to give a final response
